Influenza vaccination is recommended for all family members, close contacts, and health care workers caring for immunocompromised patients. LAIV is not recommended for household contacts of HCT recipients (within 2 months after transplant), or those with severe immunosuppression as the result of graft-versus-host disease or severe combined immune deficiency.
23 If LAIV is given to persons caring for severely immunosuppressed patients, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidelines recommend avoidance of contact for 7 days after vaccination.
